item.description:
David Lynch, director of "Mulholland Drive","Blue Velvet", and "The Elephant Man" and who had a bit to do with the TV series "Twin Peaks" has a new movie.

I know, you either love him or you hate him, and well, I fit into the first category- Mulholland Drive is one of my favorite American films over the past ten years.

And The Brattle is playing "Inland Empire" for a 2 week period. I'm hoping that by choosing a date and time this far in advance that we can get a large number of people to attend this.

The plot (so to speak) concerns an actress (Laura Dern) "whose personality becomes increasingly fragmented as she delves ever-deeper into her work for a high profile filmmaker (Jeremy Irons)".

As always, the obligatory positive review: http://www.slantmagaz...

And as always, I'll be near the front row after the film,
holding a sign. And then off to a local cafe or such to discuss afterwards.
item.name: David Lynch's New Movie at The Brattle: Inland Empire
